snippet: The Supreme Court is hearing arguments in a case in which the Arizona Legislature says it has been cut out of the district line-drawing process.
abstract: Supreme Court hears case which pits Arizona State Legislature against independent redistricting commission created by state voters; several justices hint commission, intended to make process of drawing congressional district lines less partisan, crossed constitutional line.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is hearing arguments in a case in which the Arizona Legislature says it has been cut out of the district line-drawing process.

headline.main: Court Skeptical of Arizona Plan for Less-Partisan Congressional Redistricting
headline.print_headline: Court Skeptical of Arizona Plan for Less-Partisan Congressional Redistricting
